definition: special nursing/intensive care/abbr. of 特殊護理|特殊护理
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: He was put on a life-support machine in intensive care.
sentences.chinese: 在特護期間給他使用了生命維持設備。

sentences.english: Due to the seriousness of his condition, he was put in the intensive care unit.
sentences.chinese: 由於病情嚴重，醫生把他安排在了特護病室。

sentences.english: During the holiday, I became a little life care.
sentences.chinese: 整個假期，我成了小生命的特護了。

sentences.english: A nurse directed us down the halfway to I. C. U.
sentences.chinese: 一位護士引導我們穿過走廊來到特護病房。

sentences.english: Then a blackout swept over the city, shutting down the respirators in the maternity ward.
sentences.chinese: 之後全市停電，嬰兒特護病房的呼吸機無法運行。

sentences.english: Conclusion The duration of special nursing was a manor factor affecting the costs.
sentences.chinese: 結論特護天數是影響住院費用的主要因素。

sentences.english: She remained in intensive care for a week.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽在重症特護病房裏一連待了一星期。
